snippet: Bangladesh’s Supreme Court commuted the death sentence of an Islamist political leader on Wednesday who was convicted last year of war crimes during the nation’s 1971 war for independence.
abstract: Bangladesh’s Supreme Court commutes death sentence of Islamist political leader Delwar Hossain Sayedee, who was convicted in 2013 of war crimes during nation’s 1971 war for independence.
lead_paragraph: Bangladesh’s Supreme Court commuted the death sentence of an Islamist political leader on Wednesday who was convicted last year of war crimes during the nation’s 1971 war for independence.

headline.main: Bangladesh: Islamist Leader’s Death Penalty Dropped
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh: Islamist Leader’s Death Penalty Dropped

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
